speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE I. KING JOHN'S palace.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter KING JOHN, QUEEN ELINOR, PEMBROKE, ESSEX, SALISBURY, and others, with CHATILLON

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Now, say, Chatillon, what would France with us?

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Thus, after greeting, speaks the King of France

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: In my behavior to the majesty,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The borrow'd majesty, of England here.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: A strange beginning: 'borrow'd majesty!'

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Silence, good mother; hear the embassy.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Philip of France, in right and true behalf

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Of thy deceased brother Geffrey's son,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Arthur Plantagenet, lays most lawful claim

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To this fair island and the territories,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To Ireland, Poictiers, Anjou, Touraine, Maine,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Desiring thee to lay aside the sword

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Which sways usurpingly these several titles,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: And put these same into young Arthur's hand,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Thy nephew and right royal sovereign.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What follows if we disallow of this?

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The proud control of fierce and bloody war,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To enforce these rights so forcibly withheld.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Here have we war for war and blood for blood,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Controlment for controlment: so answer France.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Then take my king's defiance from my mouth,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The farthest limit of my embassy.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Bear mine to him, and so depart in peace:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Be thou as lightning in the eyes of France;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For ere thou canst report I will be there,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The thunder of my cannon shall be heard:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: So hence! Be thou the trumpet of our wrath

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And sullen presage of your own decay.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: An honourable conduct let him have:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Pembroke, look to 't. Farewell, Chatillon.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt CHATILLON and PEMBROKE

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: What now, my son! have I not ever said

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: How that ambitious Constance would not cease

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Till she had kindled France and all the world,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Upon the right and party of her son?

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: This might have been prevented and made whole

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: With very easy arguments of love,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Which now the manage of two kingdoms must

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: With fearful bloody issue arbitrate.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our strong possession and our right for us.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Your strong possession much more than your right,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Or else it must go wrong with you and me:

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: So much my conscience whispers in your ear,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Which none but heaven and you and I shall hear.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Enter a Sheriff

speaker: ESSEX
text_entry: My liege, here is the strangest controversy

speaker: ESSEX
text_entry: Come from country to be judged by you,

speaker: ESSEX
text_entry: That e'er I heard: shall I produce the men?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Let them approach.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our abbeys and our priories shall pay

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This expedition's charge.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter ROBERT and the BASTARD

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What men are you?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your faithful subject I, a gentleman

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Born in Northamptonshire and eldest son,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As I suppose, to Robert Faulconbridge,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A soldier, by the honour-giving hand

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of Coeur-de-lion knighted in the field.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What art thou?

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: The son and heir to that same Faulconbridge.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Is that the elder, and art thou the heir?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: You came not of one mother then, it seems.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Most certain of one mother, mighty king;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That is well known; and, as I think, one father:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But for the certain knowledge of that truth

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I put you o'er to heaven and to my mother:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of that I doubt, as all men's children may.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Out on thee, rude man! thou dost shame thy mother

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: And wound her honour with this diffidence.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I, madam? no, I have no reason for it;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That is my brother's plea and none of mine;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The which if he can prove, a' pops me out

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: At least from fair five hundred pound a year:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Heaven guard my mother's honour and my land!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A good blunt fellow. Why, being younger born,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Doth he lay claim to thine inheritance?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I know not why, except to get the land.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But once he slander'd me with bastardy:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But whether I be as true begot or no,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That still I lay upon my mother's head,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But that I am as well begot, my liege,--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Fair fall the bones that took the pains for me!--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Compare our faces and be judge yourself.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If old sir Robert did beget us both

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And were our father and this son like him,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O old sir Robert, father, on my knee

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I give heaven thanks I was not like to thee!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Why, what a madcap hath heaven lent us here!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: He hath a trick of Coeur-de-lion's face;

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: The accent of his tongue affecteth him.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Do you not read some tokens of my son

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: In the large composition of this man?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Mine eye hath well examined his parts

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And finds them perfect Richard. Sirrah, speak,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What doth move you to claim your brother's land?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Because he hath a half-face, like my father.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: With half that face would he have all my land:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A half-faced groat five hundred pound a year!

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: My gracious liege, when that my father lived,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Your brother did employ my father much,--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Well, sir, by this you cannot get my land:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your tale must be how he employ'd my mother.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: And once dispatch'd him in an embassy

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: To Germany, there with the emperor

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: To treat of high affairs touching that time.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: The advantage of his absence took the king

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: And in the mean time sojourn'd at my father's;

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Where how he did prevail I shame to speak,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: But truth is truth: large lengths of seas and shores

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Between my father and my mother lay,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: As I have heard my father speak himself,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: When this same lusty gentleman was got.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Upon his death-bed he by will bequeath'd

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: His lands to me, and took it on his death

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: That this my mother's son was none of his;

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: And if he were, he came into the world

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Full fourteen weeks before the course of time.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Then, good my liege, let me have what is mine,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: My father's land, as was my father's will.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Sirrah, your brother is legitimate;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Your father's wife did after wedlock bear him,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And if she did play false, the fault was hers;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Which fault lies on the hazards of all husbands

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That marry wives. Tell me, how if my brother,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Who, as you say, took pains to get this son,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Had of your father claim'd this son for his?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In sooth, good friend, your father might have kept

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This calf bred from his cow from all the world;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In sooth he might; then, if he were my brother's,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My brother might not claim him; nor your father,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Being none of his, refuse him: this concludes;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My mother's son did get your father's heir;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Your father's heir must have your father's land.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Shall then my father's will be of no force

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: To dispossess that child which is not his?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of no more force to dispossess me, sir,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Than was his will to get me, as I think.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Whether hadst thou rather be a Faulconbridge

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: And like thy brother, to enjoy thy land,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Or the reputed son of Coeur-de-lion,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Lord of thy presence and no land beside?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, an if my brother had my shape,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And I had his, sir Robert's his, like him;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And if my legs were two such riding-rods,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My arms such eel-skins stuff'd, my face so thin

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That in mine ear I durst not stick a rose

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Lest men should say 'Look, where three-farthings goes!'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And, to his shape, were heir to all this land,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Would I might never stir from off this place,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I would give it every foot to have this face;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I would not be sir Nob in any case.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I like thee well: wilt thou forsake thy fortune,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Bequeath thy land to him and follow me?

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I am a soldier and now bound to France.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brother, take you my land, I'll take my chance.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your face hath got five hundred pound a year,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Yet sell your face for five pence and 'tis dear.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, I'll follow you unto the death.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Nay, I would have you go before me thither.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Our country manners give our betters way.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What is thy name?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Philip, my liege, so is my name begun,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Philip, good old sir Robert's wife's eldest son.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: From henceforth bear his name whose form thou bear'st:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Kneel thou down Philip, but rise more great,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Arise sir Richard and Plantagenet.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brother by the mother's side, give me your hand:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My father gave me honour, yours gave land.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now blessed by the hour, by night or day,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When I was got, sir Robert was away!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: The very spirit of Plantagenet!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I am thy grandam, Richard; call me so.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, by chance but not by truth; what though?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Something about, a little from the right,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: In at the window, or else o'er the hatch:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who dares not stir by day must walk by night,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And have is have, however men do catch:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Near or far off, well won is still well shot,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And I am I, howe'er I was begot.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Go, Faulconbridge: now hast thou thy desire;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A landless knight makes thee a landed squire.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Come, madam, and come, Richard, we must speed

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For France, for France, for it is more than need.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brother, adieu: good fortune come to thee!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For thou wast got i' the way of honesty.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt all but BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A foot of honour better than I was;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But many a many foot of land the worse.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Well, now can I make any Joan a lady.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'Good den, sir Richard!'--'God-a-mercy, fellow!'--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And if his name be George, I'll call him Peter;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For new-made honour doth forget men's names;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'Tis too respective and too sociable

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For your conversion. Now your traveller,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He and his toothpick at my worship's mess,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And when my knightly stomach is sufficed,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Why then I suck my teeth and catechise

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My picked man of countries: 'My dear sir,'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thus, leaning on mine elbow, I begin,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'I shall beseech you'--that is question now;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And then comes answer like an Absey book:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'O sir,' says answer, 'at your best command;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: At your employment; at your service, sir;'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'No, sir,' says question, 'I, sweet sir, at yours:'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so, ere answer knows what question would,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Saving in dialogue of compliment,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And talking of the Alps and Apennines,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The Pyrenean and the river Po,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: It draws toward supper in conclusion so.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But this is worshipful society

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And fits the mounting spirit like myself,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For he is but a bastard to the time

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That doth not smack of observation;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so am I, whether I smack or no;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And not alone in habit and device,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exterior form, outward accoutrement,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But from the inward motion to deliver

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sweet, sweet, sweet poison for the age's tooth:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Which, though I will not practise to deceive,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Yet, to avoid deceit, I mean to learn;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For it shall strew the footsteps of my rising.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But who comes in such haste in riding-robes?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What woman-post is this? hath she no husband

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That will take pains to blow a horn before her?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter LADY FAULCONBRIDGE and GURNEY

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O me! it is my mother. How now, good lady!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What brings you here to court so hastily?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Where is that slave, thy brother? where is he,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: That holds in chase mine honour up and down?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My brother Robert? old sir Robert's son?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Colbrand the giant, that same mighty man?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Is it sir Robert's son that you seek so?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Sir Robert's son! Ay, thou unreverend boy,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Sir Robert's son: why scorn'st thou at sir Robert?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: He is sir Robert's son, and so art thou.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: James Gurney, wilt thou give us leave awhile?

speaker: GURNEY
text_entry: Good leave, good Philip.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Philip! sparrow: James,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: There's toys abroad: anon I'll tell thee more.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exit GURNEY

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, I was not old sir Robert's son:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sir Robert might have eat his part in me

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Upon Good-Friday and ne'er broke his fast:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sir Robert could do well: marry, to confess,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Could he get me? Sir Robert could not do it:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: We know his handiwork: therefore, good mother,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To whom am I beholding for these limbs?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sir Robert never holp to make this leg.

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Hast thou conspired with thy brother too,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: That for thine own gain shouldst defend mine honour?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: What means this scorn, thou most untoward knave?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Knight, knight, good mother, Basilisco-like.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What! I am dubb'd! I have it on my shoulder.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But, mother, I am not sir Robert's son;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I have disclaim'd sir Robert and my land;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Legitimation, name and all is gone:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Then, good my mother, let me know my father;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Some proper man, I hope: who was it, mother?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Hast thou denied thyself a Faulconbridge?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As faithfully as I deny the devil.

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: King Richard Coeur-de-lion was thy father:

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: By long and vehement suit I was seduced

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: To make room for him in my husband's bed:

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Heaven lay not my transgression to my charge!

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Thou art the issue of my dear offence,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Which was so strongly urged past my defence.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now, by this light, were I to get again,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, I would not wish a better father.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Some sins do bear their privilege on earth,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so doth yours; your fault was not your folly:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Needs must you lay your heart at his dispose,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Subjected tribute to commanding love,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Against whose fury and unmatched force

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The aweless lion could not wage the fight,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Nor keep his princely heart from Richard's hand.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He that perforce robs lions of their hearts

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: May easily win a woman's. Ay, my mother,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: With all my heart I thank thee for my father!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who lives and dares but say thou didst not well

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When I was got, I'll send his soul to hell.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Come, lady, I will show thee to my kin;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And they shall say, when Richard me begot,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If thou hadst said him nay, it had been sin:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who says it was, he lies; I say 'twas not.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt
